attributes.action: keep the National Football Museum in Preston
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Preston is at the risk of losing its iconic football museum to Manchester.
The National Football Museum could be forced to move from its home on Sir Tom Finney Way, Deepdale, to Manchester due to a lack of funding. The museum has been based in Preston since it was opened in 2001 thanks to a multi-million pound lottery grant. Deepdale was chosen as home to the museum as it is one of the most deprived areas in the region. So far the museum has attracted hundreds of thousands of people through its doors, meeting all visitor targets.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to keep the National Football Museum in Preston.

Her Majesty's Government has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.hmg.gov.uk/epetition-responses/petition-view.aspx?epref=FootballMuseum


Her Majesty's Government
